alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 5:10PM MST until January 01 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 510 PM MST, emergency management reported showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Whitlow Canyon and Queen Creek through Queen Valley. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Superior, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, Queen Valley, Florence Junction, Gold Camp, Kings Ranch and Boyce Thompson Arboretum. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 202 and 209...and near mile marker 210. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 149 and 150. This includes the following streams and drainages... Tortilla Creek, Barge Creek, La and Queen Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
